Key Arguments: The legislation undermines freedom of speech and opinion.
Censorship of opinions by the government is incompatible with a democratic society.
The bill denies public opinion, civil rights, and the right to reply.
Without robust debate, democracy cannot be open and transparent.
The bill is overreaching and violates inalienable human rights.
Notable Quotes: You cannot have democracy without freedom of speech or freedom of opinion.
This Bill denies public opinion, freedom of speech, civil rights, and the right to reply.
This bill is overreaching and violates the Australian peoples inalienable human rights.
